definition: see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1

sentences.english: The annual traditional festival Mid-Autumn Festival, countless lovers and eventually became dependents places.
sentences.chinese: 每年的中秋传统佳节，无数的有情人终成眷宿。

sentences.english: May the joy of the Sping Festival be with you throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 愿新春佳节的喜悦，伴随您度过新的一年。

sentences.english: At this festive occasion, wish business was flourishing.
sentences.chinese: 值此佳节之际，恭祝事业蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: A holiday wish from your son Tom.
sentences.chinese: 寄上佳节的祝愿，你们的女子汤姆敬上。

sentences.english: In an atmosphere of joy, new and old friends celebrated the Chinese traditional festival together.
sentences.chinese: 在欢乐的气氛中，新朋老友一起欢度中国的传统佳节。

sentences.english: Wishing you and yours a merry Cristmas this holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 至此佳节祝您全家节日快乐。

sentences.english: The day after tomorrow, we will be celebrating the traditional Chinese holiday, the Mid-Autumn Festival.
sentences.chinese: 再过两天，就是一年一度的中国传统佳节中秋节。

sentences.english: So may God bless those brave men and women in uniform who are away from their families this holiday season.
sentences.chinese: 请上帝保佑这些在佳节之际仍远在他乡的英勇士兵们。

sentences.english: There s no place like home for the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在这个佳节里，没有比家更好的地方了。

sentences.english: Lantern Festival is generally considered the last day of the Chinese Lunar New Year.
sentences.chinese: 元宵节一般被认为是中国新春佳节的最后一天。

sentences.english: With Miele, everyday is a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 与美诺一起的日子，每日都是佳节。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival, north Korea's women wear new.
sentences.chinese: 新春佳节，朝鲜的妇女穿戴一新。

sentences.english: People always become extremely homesick when festivals come, especially on Mid-Autumn Festival, the most traditional one.
sentences.chinese: 每逢佳节倍思亲，特别是中秋节，最传统的节日。

sentences.english: Looking at this round is over the moon festival.
sentences.chinese: 望着这轮已过了佳节的明月。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Spring Festival, good business.
sentences.chinese: 值此新春佳节之际，恭祝事业蒸蒸日上。

sentences.english: A holiday wish from your son xily.
sentences.chinese: 寄上佳节的祝福，你们的儿子夕沥敬上。

definition: the beginning of Spring/the 10 or 20 days following the lunar New Year's Day
the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to be about to arrive/to be around the corner
doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1
